title: The famous history of Sir Thomas VVyat With the coronation of Queen Mary, and the coming in of King Philip. As it was plaied by the Queens Maiesties Seruants. Written by Thomas Dickers, and Iohn Webster.
author: Dekker, Thomas, ca. 1572-1632.
publisher: Printed by E[dward] A[llde] for Thomas Archer, and are to be solde at his shop in the Popes-head Pallace nere the Royall Exchange,
notes: Probably derived from the two parts of the lost play "Lady Jane", by Dekker, Thomas Heywood, John Webster, Henry Chettle, and Wentworth Smith.
The first word of the title is xylographic.
Running title reads: The famous historie of Sir Thomas Wyat.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
